info.name: ICON Report API
info.description: The ICON REST API allows you to programmatically place orders for Business reports on companies, Debtor Risk Assessments, Credit Opinions. You also can monitor and retrieve monitoring notifications on companies. # Playground In addition to this API guide, there is a [playground](ui) where you can try out the API calls directly from your web-browser. # Endpoints The ICON Business Information REST API is available at the following REST endpoints: | Instance | TEST TEST Base URL for REST Endpoints | |-------------------------|-----------------------------| | Production | https://b2b.cofacecentraleurope.com/api/bi/v1 | | Test | https://cce-test.icon.ua.coface.com/web/api/bi/v1/ | The Production endpoint provides access to your live user data (and orders will be charged to your account). The Test endpoint is a good place to test your code without affecting real-world data. To try out the API, you can use the Test endpoint with the demo API key 8842ace2-e377-48d9-b129-f952950ea535. To get your own API keys (Test or Production), contact us and ask to enable API access for your account. # Authentication - API Key - an API Key may be passed in the "api_key" header or as an "api_key" request parameter. Notes on API Keys: * API keys are specific to Test or Production. * An API Keys is associated with a user account. To create an API key, log on to the online application, go to your profile and create an API key. If this feature is not available, then your account has not yet been enabled for API access - contact us. * To revoke an existing API key, go to your profile and create a new API key - you will be warned that the old one will be revoked. * A demo API key (8842ace2-e377-48d9-b129-f952950ea535) is available for testing purposes (at the Test endpoint). A limited set of data is available to the demo API key. # Formats If you are planning to retrieve our products in XML or JSON please find below links to our schema. JSON schema download. XML schema download. # Errors The API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate the success or failure of the API call. The body of the response will be JSON in the following format: ``` { "message": "page not found" } ``` # Rate Limits API access rate limits are applied at a per-key basis in unit time. Access to the API using a key is limited to *60 requests per minute*. In addition, every API response is accompanied by the following set of headers to identify the status of your consumption. | Header | Description | |-----------------------|-------------------------| | X-RateLimit-Limit | The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per minute. | | X-RateLimit-Remaining | The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window. | If you are hitting this limit, further requests will be rejected with an HTTP 429 error. If you believe that due to the nature you intend to use the api your limit needs to be increased then please contact us. # Paging The API uses offset and limit parameters for paged operations. An X-Total-Count header is added to responses to indicate the total number of items in a paged response. # Language For content which is language-specific, the language can be selected in the user's profile (i.e. the user associated with the API key). Alternatively the Accept-Language header may be used to specify a language, which will then override the language selected in the user's profile. # Cross-Origin Resource Sharing This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) implemented in compliance with [W3C spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/). And that allows cross-domain communication from the browser. All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site. # Code samples Github Additional information and code samples demonstrating the use of the API can be found at https://github.com/coface/business-information-api. # USE CASES The following simple use cases provide an overview of how API operations can be used in typical scenarios. ## Ordering a credit report for a company Assuming you have the name and address of a company for which you want a report. First use the "findCompany" operation to find the company (or "identifyCompany" if you have a unique identifer for the company). This returns a list of matching companies. Using the "company_id" of the selected company, order a report on the company using the "placeOrder" operation. The response contains the id of the order. The "getOrder" operation is used to check the status of an order. When the order is ready, "getOrderDocumentList" will return a list of documents for the order and "getOrderDocument" will return the selected document (the credit report). ## Monitoring a company When you monitor a company, you receive notifications each time new data becomes available about the company. To monitor a company, use the "placeMonitoringOrder" operation. To retrieve monitoring notifications, use the "getNotifications" operation. Use the "getNotificationDocument" to retrieve the report associated with each notification.

request.description: Lists the available demo companies

query.description: A flexible free-text search query (as you would use in a search engine). Company names, addresses and company identifieres are searched. Results are ordered by relevance
country where the company is registered (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code)
name (or partial name) of the company
If set to true, the company name will be searched using a phonetic algorithm
the postal code of the company
If set to true, the city will be searched using a phonetic algorithm
starting point within paged results (the X-Total-Count header of the response indicates the total number of results found)
number of results to fetch starting from offset (the X-Total-Count header of the response indicates the total number of results found)

request.description:
Search for companies using name or other identifiers.

Tips for searching:
* If you have a unique identifier for the company (i.e. you want exactly one result), use identifyCompany instead.
* You don't need to include the legal form in the name (e.g. if the company is called PRINT Solutions Ltd, just search for PRINT Solutions).

Allowed combinations:
* full_text_query
* full_text_query with country_iso_code
* company_name and/or zip_code and/or city together with country_iso_code

query.description: country to search in (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code)
unique id of the company
ICON number of the company
EASY number of the company
the type of the national identifier to search for (use getIdentifiers to find out which identifiers are available per country)
the national identifier to search for

request.description:
Find a company using a unique identifier (returns exactly 1 or 0 results).

Tips for finding a company:
* If you are searching using national identifiers, provide the country (via the country_iso_code)
* You don't need to include the legal form in the name (e.g. if the company is called PRINT Solutions Ltd, just search for PRINT Solutions).

variable.description: (Required) ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code (for instance "PL" for Poland)

request.description: Lists the available identifiers for the country (some company identifiers are country-specific).
List the countries in which you can order reports on companies.
List the countries in which you can order reports on companies.

query.description: your own identifier for the order which you provided when you placed the order
product code (a value from code table CC8800)
the earliest order date for which to get orders
the latest order date for which to get orders
the earliest delivery date for which to get orders
the latest delivery date for which to get orders
starting point within paged results (the X-Total-Count header of the response indicates the total number of results found)
number of results to fetch starting from offset (the X-Total-Count header of the response indicates the total number of results found)

request.description: Find an order in your order history.

variable.description: (Required) the unique id of the order (returned from placeOrder) to which the comment should be submitted.

request.description: Lists the documents (e.g. reports) associated with an order.

variable.description: (Required) the unique id of the order (returned from placeOrder) to which the comment should be submitted.
(Required) the file name if the document (as returned from getOrderDocumentList).

request.description: Retrieve a document (e.g. a report) associated with a finished order. The document may take some time to be created, so you need to check that the order status is "finished" before you retrieve the document (see GET '/order/{id}/status' above). You can see an example of this workflow at https://github.com/coface/business-information-api/blob/master/python/complete-workflows/search-order-download.py

body.raw:
{
  "customer_reference": "OUR TRACKING NUMBER #34234",
  "contact_name": "Tom Smith",
  "contact_email": "tom@smith.com",
  "contact_telephone": "+43-1-62552-410",
  "contact_fax": "+43-1-62552-444",
  "comment": "Please ensure that you include all directors of this company"
}

variable.description: (Required) the unique id of the order (returned from placeOrder) to which the comment should be submitted.

request.description: Submit a comment to an order.

variable.description: (Required) the unique id of the order (returned from placeOrder).

request.description: Request an update to the status of a previously submitted order.

variable.description: (Required) the unique id of the order (returned from placeOrder)

request.description: Retrieve the details of an order.

Monitor a company to receive notifications when updated company data becomes available.

You will need to specify at least:
* the company to monitor (company_id)
* the monitoring product to order (product_details).
  * product_code: 9002 for the standard CCE Risk monitor (values from code table CC8800).
  * language: the language of notification (e.g en for english).
  * format: xml, json, pdf, html or txt.
* if you're using the demo API key, you cannot place a new monitoring order (you can check for notitifcations though)

Order a Business Report, a Score report (DRA: Debtor Risk Assessment), a Credit Opinion (CO) report and a Coface Advanced Opinion (CAO) report using the corresponding product codes from CC8800 table.

You will need to specify at least:
* the company to order (either with the company_id if the company has already been uniquely identified or with company_unidentified).
* the product to order (product_details).
  * product_code: 200 for a standard credit report (values from code table CC8800).
  * language: the language of the report (e.g en for english).
  * format: xml, json, pdf, html or txt.
* if you're using the demo API key, restrict your order to the company_id of a demo company.

variable.description: (Required)

request.description: Retrieves a monitoring notification (the main notification content). If the notification might include multiple documents then use the method /notification/{id}/documents to retrieve all documents.

Returns the server status - you can use it as a health check to ensure that the REST endpoint is active.
